Reviews.Title: “NICE Staff - Hotel needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Beach-Cowgirl22
Reviews.Content: BED was comfy & room was spacious enough. Very convenient for the 'Park & Fly out early set up' (rate was pretty reasonable) So if your just spending the night - you will most likely be ok with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What service...?”
Reviews.Author: wildkat2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location before its renovation, and one time afterwards and the experience was OK. This 2 day stay was quite unacceptable. Seems it runs in the family... The shuttle bus driver was rude, front desk clerk was friendly but inefficient, from my room I telephoned the front desk 4 times, ringing 3 minutes each time. I finally had to physically go to the desk to request a computer cord, as they do not have wireless in the rooms, only in the lobby. Why is that guests are not getting wireless, but visitors and freeloaders get free wireless? Later in the evening 3 attemptes to call roomservice...no answer. I called front desk 4 times and finally got a response, and she would go over and ask room service to call me. After another 15 min I walked to the restaurant. They said the ringer was turned too low and did not know it...yet the counter clerk said he was busy filling room service orders...? How did they get through? The next morning I observed all the socializing among workers...phones ringing off the hooks...and employees too busy on texting on their cell phones to approach me while trying to check out. The last stay at this place.....and m a Platinum Sheraton level member. Shame on Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased - No WiFi in Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TonyBur
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel since I had an early flight out the next morning and wanted a package of staying one night and leaving your car in their lot for a week. It was a decent rate for the room and parking. The rooms themselves were very nice, clean, comfortable. The shuttle was prompt. The staff were very pleasant and friendly. My only complaint is that there is no wireless in the rooms, just the lobby. There is cable internet in the rooms, and all of it is included in the price. I could not believe that a hotel that caters to business travelers would not have wireless in each room, but cause you to sit in the lobby. Many of us now travel with only an IPad and you need wireless for it. I do not want to sit in the lobby doing my internet work. This is a problem which needs to be addressed ASAP. Before it is I could not fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight before Flight”
Reviews.Author: Ron5544
Reviews.Content: We decided to lessen the early morning-get-to-the-airport stress by staying overnight at an airport hotel. Four Points had the lowest price and turned out to be a very good hotel. Clean, well-appointed rooms, friendly, helpful staff. The Shuttle comes every 20 minutes. I was very satisfied with the hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: dpack60
Reviews.Content: Average room, very limited and over priced restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Improvements”
Reviews.Author: kimba1910
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Thanksgiving weekend, I really liked the improvements made since the last time I stayed here, the only thing I don't like is that the bathroom sink is not in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: PDCE-85
Reviews.Content: Have actually stayed here twice, both times to catch early morning flights, both times having found an excellent deal through Priceline or Hotwire. In each case, we found the rooms to be clean and comfortable; in the 'new American IKEA' style. Some have complained about how small the rooms are - that did NOT jump out of us. Certainly easy for two of us to navigate about the room. (Though the sink area is admittedly small!) The property is located amidst several airport hotels, including the full service Sheraton and the Aloft hotel - each of which have options for eating - albeit it a good bit overpriced. We also like the parking option that allows you to park for $7.00 a day if you wish to leave your car during your travels. Particularly impressive during our most recent stay was the excellent service from the desk staff. Same girl checked us in around midnight, then out again early the next morning. She was very helpful and cheerful during both interactions. One thing worth noting - they DO run a shuttle to the airport, but this is the same shuttle that stops at the other two hotels in the complex as well, and the Four Points is the last stop in the circuit. A little annoying as you see you bus arrive, but it takes another 10 minutes to make it to your doorstep. Having stayed at a couple other hotels in the immediate vicinity, this was definitely the best at this price point. Would be willing to to pay advertised rates if the right Priceline deal didn't show up.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: White Bear Lake, Minnesota, United States
Reviews.Title: “OK for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G
Reviews.Content: Just your typical airport hotel. Airport shuttle was good, lobby was recently redecorated. The rest of the hotel is outdated, but OK for a one night stay. Front desk staff was friendly, but disorganized. Requested two bed, received one bed. They were fairly prompt in switching our room. The guy who brought our crib to us was the friendliest person we encountered at the hotel. As a guest of the Four Points you are able to use the indoor pool at the Sheraton Suites. Don't waste your time...disgusting, small, smelly, slippery...just gross. All in all it is an OK place to stay for one night, I'm sure there are worse places, but definitely better places to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor family service”
Reviews.Author: dromero65
Reviews.Content: the evening staff was ill-prepared to deal with families. didn't even act as if they were concerned with our requests/needs. Took the front desk 3+ hours to deliver a sleeping cot that we requested. we had a 6 year old waiting the entire time. we were told that breakfast was included in the stay; we arrive and the story changes. the staff responded with standard policy dribble. the only redeeming effort: the restaurant staff went above and beyond in their duties - reggie in particular did a great job in serving his customers!! great work there.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: leapgal44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so so. The day time front desk staff was very rude with me. The other staff were very friendly. The parking is secure by use of a security gate. However, there was a group of motorcyclists that ran right around the gate, so that made me uneasy. I arrived late at night & the only hot food to be found was at the main Sheraton across the street. It was dark to be out walking to get a bite to eat. The room was clean & well-equipped. There was WiFi connection available which is a plus. There is a shuttle to & from airport. But the driver practically threw my luggage out of the shuttle, letting me to handle it through to the check in desk. And I do tip & felt the driver was rude since it is called free shuttle service. Would not recommend this hotel. I walked over to the Hilton during the day hours & everyone I met there was very pleasant. Hilton is a better choice for hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly quite clean”
Reviews.Author: wnbaaddict
Reviews.Content: Staff great rooms clean no loud noise even though its right at airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very friendly, helpful staff, but.....”
Reviews.Author: ehartlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two different nights. The staff was helpful and very friendly. We had an upgraded room. The room was comfortable, but I was surprised with some of the shoddy construction work that I observed in the bathrooms. On both visits we needed to ask for soap for the room. On one visit I had to ask for the housekeeping to put the duvet cover on the bed. The hallways and our room were not adequately vacuumed. I think this hotel has to improve on the training of their housekeeping staff. We had several meals in the hotel that were very good and the staff in the restaurant was delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a vacation”
Reviews.Author: lis137
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay, park and fly package at the Sheraton. We have tried a few hotels around the airport and feel most comfortable with our car and our making our flight at this one. The hotel room was small but clean. They have switched to the shampoo and conditioner dispensers. When we arrived, the shampoo dispenser was empty, but they replaced it quickly when we told them. They have brought room service back and it is about as cheap as eating in the restaurant and a lot easier. The food was hot and good. The shuttle to the airport runs every 20 minutes and they are a stickler on time--okay by me--I'm willing to take my lumps when I fail to show on time. When we returned, we didn't have to call the shuttle--it arrived after 5 minutes of standing at the shuttle stand. The office staff was beyond helpful--responding quickly to our needs. We will be staying here again when we have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Justtravel100
Reviews.Content: I arrived and the front desk staff wasn't familiar with the billing-corporate procedure. In my room, the AC was broken. My sheets and duvet cover were dirty. They were stained and I found hair all over the place. The bathroom wasn't not complety clean. Bed was confortable. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “u would have to pay me to stay here”
Reviews.Author: danielle1681
Reviews.Content: well there were only two things good about staying here and the bed and the ravioli w/ vodka sauce!!! I am very big on service and all though the staff was very friendly it was very hard to get in contact with them via phone and that being me calling them from my hotel room...almost anytime i called they didnt answer....tried to order food NOOO ANSWER IN RESTAURT..Had to get dressed and stuff to go .downstarirs to get food where lighting in restauraunt area at 9:30 at night is just way to bright ..restauraunt is near bar where if u like listening to loud drunk people while u enjoy a dinner after a long day is not fun.. MY TABLE WAS NOT CLEANED PROPERLY!!...... MY COFFEE POT WAS BROKE ASKED FOR A NEW COFFEE POT FROM FRONT DESK ,ANSWERED ON LIKE 20TH RING!! Waited over 40 minutes for a coffee pot to get delivered!! I am just disgusted!!@ UGHKKK SHAME ON YOU SHERATON!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only good for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Ilike2_trav3l
Reviews.Content: Teeny, tiny rooms. Not enough toilet roll for only one night stay. Teeny tiny bathroom. Extremely comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DazzlinD
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a night before a flight but really liked the hotel and would return. The beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, Common Dining Area Dirty”
Reviews.Author: flyingabpilot
Reviews.Content: I judge a hotel by several factors.. MY room - Clean, Yes, Mattress & Bedding - Great, Shower - Plenty of Hot Water, Good Water Pressure and great shower head. Free internet, TV qualilty good.. But... not so great on Food Service and cleanliness @ breakfast area. THought @ 4 Points would have a great restaurant. Table was not clean. (Didn't look like it was wiped down with in the last week.) Coffee cream curdled in my coffee. Waiter brought me new cream, but neglected to use a different creamer carafe... the line of old cream still evident. The food choice was not fantastic, Oatmeal, pancake, omelet .. No bacon, no eggs benedict, no steak and eggs, don't even think a fresh fruit option. Really reather blaise Will say though that the front desk staff was very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for sleep”
Reviews.Author: aztravelers_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on business. The room itself was satisfactory. Thats about it. The food was overpriced, and there is nothing in the area to walk to. Check in was quick and easy. The Shuttle drivers could have been a little nicer, didnt bother to get out of the van to help with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “really let down by a Sheraton hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bgdaddy1us
Reviews.Content: the hotel hallways was so throwback I was thinking I was in a different hotel from the lobby. The room was nice didn't care for the sink being right next to the door "who set that up major fail"

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Britney C
Reviews.Content: I had a very great stay. My friend was getting married so, I stayed at the four points for one week. My room was cleaned everyday. The staff was very friendly, always helpful whenever I needed something. The pool was clean, the fitness center was nice and clean as well. I would definitely come back. Everything was just right besides the parking fee :(.

Reviews.Title: “Basically a motel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaMember
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a great Four Points by Sheraton in New Orleans in May, so I was expecting a comparable hotel in Philadelphia. Instead I was extremely disappointed by the Four Points by Sheraton at the Philadelphia airport. The staff at the front desk was friendly, but the hotel was a dump. It is the worst hotel I have stayed at in a long time. (I was just thankful that there were no bed bugs.) Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back..at least not to Sheraton properties..”
Reviews.Author: toritraveler
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t let the Sheraton name fool you, this place is basic â€“ youâ€™ll do better at a Holiday Inn. The staff is nice; everyone I interacted with was friendly. The room was substandard, and dirty. The bathroom was filthy and didnâ€™t have shower gel, we told the front desk but nothing was ever done about it. Thank god I had a bar of Dial on me, ha! The bathroom was also smaller than a closet and the sink and mirror was separated (think Motel 6). Stains on the furniture, dirty carpet (came with white socks, left with black). The hall was dirty and very noisy at night. Security was actually knocking on a few doors throughout my stay to have people calm down. The type of people that stay here are the less sophisticated it seems. In addition, they have a huge parking lot with plenty of space, but zing you for $7/day. I was charged $4.50 for two cups of coffee in the lobby that was supposedly free?? The guy said that was the equivalent of a â€œsmall pot,â€� WHAT A JOKE. Iâ€™m used to four star properties so this was all devastating to me. Furthermore, I was talked in to buying an â€œExplorer Time Shareâ€� package with Sheraton last year. So I was trying out the hotels and the whole â€œstar pointâ€� thing. Let me say...Preferred Guests are NOT treated any differently. I think we get free water and thatâ€™s it. 2 bottlesâ€¦and 40 cent value!!! LOL. I also found it ironic that almost every single room was a Starwood Preferred Guest Room. I guess many can be fooled, but I watch things like that like a hawk and buying a Timeshare with Sheraton is NO DEAL. I canâ€™t wait to use up these points so I can go back to my 4 stars on Priceline. Finally..the pool area is neglected and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: Not to pick on this hotel, but I will say it again - true hospitality and friendliness are becoming rarities in the hospitality industry. Staff is pleasant, but that personal touch is slowly disappearing. That being said, nice property, great location and close to all you want to see in Philly. The hotel bartender was nice, but not much for personality. I worked over 20 years in the retail and sales arena and just know how important the one on one interactions are in business. Clean, nice, well maintained and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: perk722
Reviews.Content: we fly out of philly alot, and usually stay at 4 points. staff is professional. ww were waiting for a van to take us to the motel,when the van drove by without stopping. called to complain, and hotel sent a driver out to pick us up. very apologetic

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: pr0pel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention. Despite it being a bit far from downtown Phila, getting to the hotel was not a problem. Initially before arrival, I called the hotel and asked the how far they were from the Eastwick station of the SEPTA (I was coming from NYC via Amtrak and connecting to SEPTA) and the woman told me it was around the corner and a short walk away. Upon getting off at Eastwick, I was pretty much left in the middle of no where. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the station and you have to pass multiple lanes of a busy street as well as under a freeway with no walkway connecting one side. Luckily I had Google maps on my side and upon getting to the front desk, they told me the following... Catch the shuttle from the airport -- no apologies or anything. Anyway, like I said, if you're trying to get to this hotel, just take the SEPTA to the airport and follow the signs for ground transportation to get the shuttle. Anyway, about the hotel. It's your common Four Points. Friendly staff and great rooms. Breakfast was a bit overpriced and there is free coffee in the lobby. Despite it taking 45 minutes to refill at one point, I had no issues. There aren't many options for dinner nearby so we just went to the Sheraton which is in the same complex. The complex consists of 3 hotels. There is only free wifi in the lobby with free WIRED internet in the rooms. If you're lucky enough to pickup the wifi from the lobby, you are golden. Other than that, for a quick stay, you will have no problems here.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, dirty, loud, messy”
Reviews.Author: theresaw
Reviews.Content: Checked in, went to my room and couldn't believe the amount of kids running amok up and down the halls after 9pm. Had to call downstairs twice to get anyone to do anything about it, and the solution? Moving me! Followed hotel worker down scary, dark hallway to my "new" room and immediately called downstairs and demanded to be moved to another Sheraton. My room was down at end of hallway - carpet was stained and there was litter scattered about. At end of hallway was a door with yellow tape across it that said "construction zone". Bright light behind door and strange noises. There was no way I was staying there. Inside room was gross, dirty -- stains on bedding, upholstered chair. I wouldn't touch a thing. Got out as soon as I could! Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Most overpriced airport hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Molokairaceofficial
Reviews.Content: Good points: in a safe neighborhood which is hard to find near PHL. Bad points: bathroom shower was filthy, no bar soap for sink, coffee in room was previously open, no wifi in rooms (only in Lobby), $7.00 to park. A real disappointment a After depending on the Starwood reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Two Stars, at best”
Reviews.Author: Dawn_St_Charles
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor has this hotel rated as a 3 star but I would give it 1.5 starts, 2 at best. Its poorly maintained, and lacking in cleanliness and decor. I stayed here in Room 315 and it was my first time at this hotel. The lobby looked nice and interesting, but I don't have much else good to say about this hotel other than the service at the bar for dinner was good. The elevators were jerky and stopped at every floor, regardless of whether or not it was called to the floor...so it took a long time to get between floors. The hallways were very dirty (heavily stained carpets) and institutional, like something out of The Shining. There were numerous trays of food on the floor up and down the hallway when I checked in early evening, that were still there the next day when I was checking out. My room was bright but smelled like an ashtray. There were cigarette burn marks in the sink; the hotel claims to charge patrons a $200 cleaning fee if they smoke in the room but if they are collecting the money, they certainly aren't using it to clean the room. The bathroom smelled like urine and the floors in the entrance and bathroom (non carpeted surfaces) were sticky (possibly the source of the urine smell) and looked like they had not been cleaned in some time so I had to walk around in socks. The TV worked, kind of..there was audio but no video so you could listen to the TV but not watch it. I was awoken at 3am by a loud screeching sound (think nails, chalkboard) that was coming from water running in a pipe from an adjacent room. I met two other frequent travelers at dinner at the bar and both had a long list of complaints about the hotel so the three of us commisserated for a bit and decided we would not be back to this Four Points. Unless you are on a tight budget, I'd recommend looking elsewhere in this vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to give it a 2.5, but that is not available.”
Reviews.Author: dave s
Reviews.Content: The Four Points by Sheraton was not a poor hotel, but it was below average. The halls and elevator floors we heavily worn and dirty. They even needed to be vacuumed...and were not during the 48 hours that we were there.The room was adequate and clean, but the sink drained very slowly. We called and requested the sink to be cleared, yet the assistance never came. The beds were comfortable and the room had a nice TV and desk. However, there had been a storm and the direc TV stopped working. We called the from desk about the TV, and were told that the storm was blocking reception. Fair enough. However, the following morning (like 9 am), the Direc TV reception still did not work and there were no clouds in the sky. I was just ready to go, so we did not complain. It was just another sub-par experience at this hotel. Finally, the internet showed that there were coin-operated laundry facilities in the hotel. The laundry was not in this hotel, but in the other Sheraton-operated hotel across the parking lot. This was inconvenient and a bummer, but not a huge issue. This hotel seems like it is awaiting renovation. I do want to end with the employees of this hotel. They were pleasant and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, at least no bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Codeedo
Reviews.Content: The obvious reason to stay here is the proximity to the airport which is a short ride away. The hotel appears to be doing some updates but like so many hotels these days, the lobby looks clean and new and the corridors and rooms do not. Most off-putting are the dark brown doors to the rooms which make it look like an old dorm. The rooms themselves are okay -- clean and no bedbugs (I thoroughly checked the mattress and cross-checked on the bedbugregistry.com). Make SURE you request a non-smoking room. We were originally given a smoking room -- we didn't even enter the room, just opening the door was like inhaling an ash tray. To their credit they immediately gave us another room and even ran the room keys upstairs to us so we didn't have to lug everything around. Also provided a free bottle of water in every room which was a nice change from the $2.75 bottle usually found.... On the other hand, their system of making you go to the front desk with your parking ticket and charging you every time you leave their gated lot was a hassle and a big added expense if you have to leave occasionally as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Experience spoiled but initial trouble”
Reviews.Author: Pyongyangsucks
Reviews.Content: Joined my GF that was participating a tradeshow/conference. Arrived late at night and was told hotel was full. No availability on the other properties in the vicinity either. The other party of 3 that arrived at the same time faced the same problem. They put all of us in a van and took us to a Quinta or Days Inn (don't remember anymore) that was almost 1 hour away, in New Jersey. Next morning, got a car back to the hotel and from there to the Conv, Center - of course all paid by 4 Points; and we also got a voucher for b'fast. I guess we got a rennovated room, it was bright and clean, free wi-fi - wouldn't accept nothing less after the hassle of the 1st night. The breakfast - nothing special but it is very expensive. The comp voucher we were given was not for a full breakfast but was good for x dollars, that was not enough for a standard farel. Hungry? Better hop on your car and eat out. anyway, what kind of hotel overbooks, is not aware of the overbooking and don't take measurements ahead of our arrival. Welcome to Four Points.... Of course the 1st night at Quinta/Days Inn was not charged but does not compensate for the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “4 days of cold showers...but nice staff”
Reviews.Author: 4thtrifit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton 4 points by the airport while in town for the NCAA Wrestling Championships. Our room was part of a group booking and there was a mistake. We were in a king room instead of a room with 2 queens .... they arranged for a rollaway for our son which was so bad, he almost decided to sleep on the floor. At least they didn't charge us for it. You could actually feel the springs coming thru. Good thing he is a college kid and can sleep anywhere. The bathroom is TINY and has one small sink area. We kept having to ask for 3 sets of towels instead of 2, even though it was obvious that there were 3 of us in the room. They were happy to bring more - I just got tired of asking for it everyday. The worst part though was that we couldn't get hot water out of the shower. It would come out of the lower tap warm in spurts, but the diverter must have been broken as it was COLD out of the shower. The first day I said nothing cuz I thought "well, the hotel is full and everyone is showering." The second day we were out of the room early and home late. The third morning, I said something. It was attended to but didn't get fixed. We were reimbursed about 1/2 the day's rate. The next day, still no hot water, I said something again. We were told "well, you should have said something the first day"... The insult to injury was that they kept running out of coffee in the morning. I needed hot coffee after a cold shower. Yes - the hotel was full but that is not an excuse. They also seemed understaffed in the "restaurant". BE aware that it appears as if the hotel is going thru renovations. I won't stay again at a Sheraton 4 points. At least at a Hampton inn and other hotels of the same level, you are guaranteed 100% satisfaction and they mean it.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy. CURLY BLACK HAIR IN BED”
Reviews.Author: icode4food
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of selecting this hotel for business travel. The hotel looks nothing like its photos. The lobby looks ok at first glance but then the elevator doors open and you get onto an elevator which has problems opening and closing the doors. The carpet is filthy and looks like it hasn't been vacuumed in weeks. You exit the elevator at your floor and it continues to get worse as you walk to your room. The carpet is worn. Lack of vacuuming again. The hallway smells like smoke on a non smoking floor. Open up the poop brown door into my room and it is beat up looking too. The bathroom was dirty and scary. I had to pick something off the toilet seat. My sink was broken and would not drain. Maintenance came up to fix the problem. Slipped into my PJs was about to get into bed until a little voice in my head told me to inspect the bed for bed bugs since the place was so filthy. Thank god I did. There was a CURLY BLACK HAIR in the sheets at the top of the bed. GROSS! Immediately called the front desk and asked to be moved rooms. They moved me to another room on the same beat up floor. I could hear the guy in the room next to me. The room was beat up as well. I was too terrified to stay so I packed up again and left. I ended up staying at the Hyatt at Penn's Landing. SOOOO much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: gec13
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced. Clean and comfortable. We recently stayed before an early flight and were pleasantly surprised. Parking was rasonable at $7.00 a day within a gated area. Hotel accomodations were good, staff was very friendly and helpful. Shuttle to the airport ran every twenty minutes. Upon our return we called after we picked up our luggage and they came to get us within 15 minutes. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: PG-NJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Friday night, Feb. 18, and used their stay,park, and fly package as we arrived late Friday night and were catching an early morning flight. It was a little hard to find as the hotel is in a complex with 3 other hotels however it is right next to the airport. I parked in a well lit area and although the area was a bit sketchy, things were fine as there are so many people around. The staff couldn't be friendlier while giving me detailed instuctions about calling the shuttle in the morning and upon my arrival back home. Everything worked fine. Our room was clean and comfortable.......not exquisite but a place to rest and sleep for the maybe 6 hours that we were there. I would definitiely stay there again in the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: sport10010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the way to Philadelphia. Good location outside the city. Nice hotel, plenty of parking. Well priced. Keep in mind that it is a 20-30 minute drive to the center of town. We were pleased with the price/performance.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels next door”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromDallas
Reviews.Content: The staff was great The food was good, but nothing in the morning until after 6, not even coffee The shuttle was late Bed was hard, what happened to the sheraton wonder bed? L

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: michrbab
Reviews.Content: Imagine this situation, you're traveling, you're flight gets delayed, so your significant other helpfully tries to book you a hotel so that you can get some sleep before making a drive home. Your significant other is assured, "no problem, we have rooms - send her over!" You arrive at the property, to be told (at 2:15 AM), "I'm in the middle of an audit and I can't check you in." "I'll call some other hotels to see if they can accomodate you." I couldn't believe that this happened to me recently. I'm astounded that any hotel would decide to 1. not take revenue from a paying guest and 2. would be so devious on the phone as to offer a room, and then retract it once the customer arrives. What was the point of offerring a room? I have stayed in this hotel on other occasions, and while it's nothing special, I was just seeking a bed to rest in for a few hours. I would avoid this hotel if at all possible, there are plenty of other options in the Philly airport area, nicer and more resonably priced, and with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sailorgirl222
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not as bad as some people say it is. The lobby and rooms are very modern and clean. The service is outstanding. Check-in and check-out is a breeze and the staff is very friendly. My only complaints are that the hallways look old and outdated and the tub was slow to drain. Hopefully, they will update the hallways to match the modern feel of the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe All The Good Reviews Nor Should You Believe All the Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jooksing
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at 4 Points Sheraton. It is obvious they are targeting the Hilton Garden Inn or Hampton Inn customer. The hotel is very close to airport and I received a great deal to stay at the hotel. I was apprehensive to stay here because of all the mediocre and poor reviews listed at this website. The Good - The hotel staff is very friendly and doing to the best to work with a tired old hotel. The hotel is conveniently located near the airport. I received a very decent rate to stay here two nights The Not So Good - The hallways project sound to the rooms. The rooms are older and need more than a superficial face lift. My room had vents choked with dust and lint. I complained and no one fixed it. The shower had a very slow drain (I can't stand that). The middle of the bed was very mushy. This won't be at the top of my list to stay when I return but it may be near the bottom half. I would stay here again if it was a 1 night or maybe a 2 night trip. I would not stay here if it was more than $130 a night. It is hard to find a decent and inexpensive airport hotel to stay at these days near any large city. Most of these airport hotels are tired properties, over priced, and constantly full.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal but?????”
Reviews.Author: cath102
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Hotel.com; two double beds at a good price. Hotel was clean, staff very nice. But beware, booked for four adults & got a king with rollaway. One adult had to sleep in a chair. Had several calls from desk, they were sorry but it didn't help the situation. They told us that they did not have to honor expedia, hotel.com etc. Now I am aware. Never had this problem before.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, close to airport, clean”
Reviews.Author: jeremywearsvans
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times. They have a free shuttle that is always on time to and from the airport which is cool. They don't seem to do room service and the bar closes early but there are several other sheraton hotels very close by so I was told I can check those out for food options so your not really screwed when it comes to locating food. the elevator is really noisy and a little creepy. You do have to pay for parking but I usually just catch the shuttle. The only thing that I found a little wierd was that when you check in you have to sign a paper promising you won't have more than 5 people in your room? I think it's to prevent people from partying. I'd recommend this hotel though it's safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only”
Reviews.Author: smep013
Reviews.Content: Booked one night here VERY last minute - at 9PM for an 11PM check-in, to be closer to airport before an early morning flight. Lobby was bright and welcomming, modern and clean. Lack of food and drink options at that time of night. Rooms were not bright and welcomming. When I booked was told we'd have a room with a King. The only such room was next to the elevator room and they forewarned us it was loud. And it was. We managed to fall asleep though. Room was older and not very comfortable. Bathroom was small, sink was outside the bathroom. Fine for what we needed, but I'd explore other airport options next time. Annoying that you had to pay to park, but shuttle to airport was on time and free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: sunny45
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and very close to airport. Room was a nice size and had a flat screen LCD TV. Bathroom was a good size with the normal toiletries available. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. There was plenty of parking around the hotel. There is a $7/night parking free and you have to use your room key for entrance/exit. There is an outdoor pool but we never used it and we never ate there either. The lobby is nice with a bar and a few TV's. I would stay again when flying out of PHL.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rate, comfortable, but front desk needs better customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Latinasoy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel because it was a reasonable nightly rate. It was labor day weekend and the hotels near the city were nearly booked and triple the price. Considering that this hotel is close to the airport, it wasn't too bad. The room was clean and nice, the bathroom was small, but can't complain because it seemed clean. There was a church convention going on so there were tons of people and children, and to our surprise there was barely any chaos or noise coming through our room. The only complaint I have is that when we first arrived, the lady at the front desk seemed nice until everyone trying to check in was being told to give her 5minutes, which grew to 15-20mins waiting. Than this couple came out from the elevator which seemed that they knew her and she proceeded to talk to them and later got on her cell phone like she forgot that she had to check us in. I was beginning to lose my patience when she finally called us. Whenever we had questions to ask the front desk, whoever was in shift would always make faces like it was too much for them to answer or didn't have the time. So to sum it up, the experience was ok in the hotel. Maybe somebody else's experience will be different.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean hotel with HELPFUL Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle028
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel one night from Aug 27th - Aug 28th. Very clean room and hotel. Excellent staff, they were very helpful. Check in was a breeze and anything you asked for you got it within 2 minutes ie extra towels. We also asked for a fridge for our room and we got it at no extra cost. Beds: Mattress was comfy, but pillows were way too soft. Other info: You swipe your room key to get in and out of the hotel parking lot. You also have to pay $7 for parking, You have to drive about 5 minutes to get to a nearby plaza and restaurants but its not bad. I would definitely stay here again. Close to major highways and downtown Philly attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dj_clap
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay. Check-in was smooth, front desk staff was courteous. Room was clean and bright with a LCD tv. Was there to watch a Phillies game, and the hotel was located around a 5-10 minute drive (not including road construction on the I-95). The only negatives were the $7 for parking and asides from the restaurant, there are no places to eat right around the hotel property. The hotel is also location about a 10-15 minute drive from the famous Geno's and Pat's cheesesteaks. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, 2 star Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: Not up to Sheraton standards. I asked what this hotel was before it became a Sheraton and was told it was a Days Inn. The lobby is nice, but the rooms are total 2 star and definitely not worth the $90 / nt we paid. And the bar closes by 10:00 PM.

Reviews.Title: “This place blows”
Reviews.Author: moffit
Reviews.Content: I don't know who would stay at this dump unless you were required to. What a [--] no other words can describe this place. Company credit card was issued to this place and before check in I called to confirm reservations. I was informed all i needed was ID. Untill I drove the three hours on way to get here. Then the unfriendly, nasty, gready batches at the front desk would not check me in without a personal credit card ( No Got.. Company card remember) or $250 cash No got I have $ 53 on me for the week. They were willing to negotiate it down to $150. Still no got. I had to drive back home and then get up and drive back the next morning 3 hours each way plus toll tickets and work 9 hours my supervisor had to drive in and give them his card. They messed up the processing of that and wanted him to come back. No guest laundry, Ice machine broken. smells like the sewer has backed up in the parking lot Oh yeah $7 a night for that and no security. No free breakfast coffee is $7 a cup and pretty nasty to boot. a breakfast sammie is $11.50. and was cold. Old , Dirty, smelly, dangerous A lady got mugged in the lobby crappy service and arsehole employees. Stay the heck away

Reviews.Title: “For an airport stay, worth it.”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: I know what to expect when I book a three star hotel. Essentially I want a safe, clean room with a few amenities. It is usually a one or two night stay, so I'm not looking for the Taj. And I was pleased with my stay at Four Points. It was very close to the airport, offered parking, and a great shuttle service. My only complaint is the walls are a little thin so if you have noisy neighbors, it is a problem. I recommend asking for a room at the end of a hall. Staff was very helpful . . among the most polite, helpful I've encountered and I travel alot. Usually at the 3 star mark, I stay with Holiday Inn Express or Fairfield Inn. Those two chains still rank above Four Points but when those aren't available I would happily book with Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “Won't disappoint, unless you have unrealistic expectations.”
Reviews.Author: USCTrojansFan23
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying here after reading all the reviews on this website... but my girlfriend and I couldn't have been happier with our stay. We were here for 3 nights and they were great. Neither of us can complain about anything... though paying $7 per night for parking was a little irritating. The hotel was clean, easy to find, well kept, and completely satisfactory. I think people expect something fantastic because the price is so high, failing to realize that it is an airport hotel and that is why the price is jacked. You're paying for the convenience of being next to the airport, not for the accomodations themselves. As long as you go in expecting a hotel that would probably cost $115 per night elsewhere, you won't be disappointed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For an airport hotel, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: pritch0613
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch an early flight out of Philadelphia. For a one night stay, it was good (and for the $60 I paid for it on Priceline, it was great). I remember the bed being really comfortable. Ordered room service as there were no hotels nearby -- was a little expensive (I mean, it's room service) but was surprisingly good. Hallways needed a good cleaning. Free airport shuttle in the morning was on time -- there were too many people to fit on one, so they immediately brought a second behind it with no delays. Good overall for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: thatchLancaster_Pa_
Reviews.Content: I lost my laptop at the airport. The shuttle driver for the hotel took me back immediately to the airport terminal to look for it. The front desk lady stayed with my wife the whole time I was gone and helped her make calls, etc. This employee was amazing!!! I got the laptop back courtesy of a another young lady who was working at the airport. I love PHILLY people! This hotel is well managed. Stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Sparksfly000
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline. The room we were given on the 3rd floor was okay, but the bathroom was small, cramped and badly lit. The hallways are rather grungy and institutional. There was a large extended family on the same floor; a lot of running back and forth, slamming doors and crying babies. We asked to be moved, and were accommodated with another room on the 5th floor - hard to believe, but the noise level there was even worse, so we went back to the 3rd floor. By far the worst thing about this hotel is the parking system. First of all, be forewarned that you are charged $7/day to park. In order to leave or return to the lot, your room key must be inserted to activate the gate. Because the system doesn't work properly, there are constantly long lines of cars waiting as customers call the front desk to get assistance. When we returned late at night there was a line of 8 cars - one woman actually got out of her car and had to raise the gate manually. When I complained to the front desk, I got the impression this is an ongoing problem. The next morning the hallway reeked of frying bacon; whether the family next door was cooking their own breakfast, I will never know. We could not wait to leave and I will NEVER stay at a Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for One Night”
Reviews.Author: jazzyepi
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on Hotwire and stayed here to catch a very early flight and it was fine. Staff were helpful, even at 4 AM. Shuttle runs every 20 mins and is less than a 10 minute drive. Room was quiet, which was my main priority. You can keep your car in the lot while away for $7 a day, a good rate. Some reviewers seemed to be expecting a Four Seasons hotel. What you get is an adequate hotel airport, not sure it's pretending to be anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Like putting lipstick on a pig...”
Reviews.Author: MileHighGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on Thursday, October 15, 2009. I was traveling for business and was given room 302. I chose this hotel based on the information on the web site, the pictures, the price and the closeness to the airport. I caught the airport shuttle at about 5:30 PM. The shuttle made stops at the ALOFT hotel and the Sheraton Suites before getting to the Four Points. The lobby was nicely decorated and looked newly remodeled. Check in was fast and I was on my way to the room. The first thing I noticed as I exited the elevator on the 3rd floor was the old dated carpet, the harsh lighting and the lack of any attention to decor. Room 302 was at the end of one of the halls. The awful carpet continued throughout. The room doors are those big heavy steel doors painted a deep burgandy color. I entered room 302 and immediately felt like I was in a remodeled hotel that was never finished. When you enter, on the left is a cut out area for the sink with literally no counterspace and on the right the entrance to the bathroom with the dated white marble floor. The entry to the room was redone with some kind of wood laminate. The wall plate covering the air unit was coming off (see photo). Get past the bathroom and you get to the room itself. The bed was impressive, the flat screen TV more than adequate, the desk new and very modern looking, a lamp in the corner with a foot clicker to turn it off and on...all very nice. There isn't a traditional dresser though. There's a cabinet under the TV that has baskets instead of drawers. One thing, the desk seemed to have many bells and whistles but seemed overly complicated for what it's used for. In that desk is a built in filing system that housed the hotel info, etc. Unfortunately, it was incomplete. It was missing the room service menu and details on how to use the free internet. There was a rolling cart to use as a desk, I guess, but seemed like it wouldn't be much use. The desk chair was comfortable and unlike any others in hotels I've stayed in. The air...I prefer a cold room and was able to set it to 68 and it stayed that temp all night. I connected my netbook to use the internet and the ethernet cable was broken and a call to guest services brought the maintenance man with a replacement but I still couldn't get the internet to work. They gave me the number to the company that handles their tech service; an 800 number, but I was charged .99 to make the call. The internet then worked. Without a room service menu I decided to go to the lobby restaurant to order dinner to bring back to the room. At the bar I ordered an angus burger and a slice of cheesecake. The bill was $24. I brought it back to the room and was eating when the hotelwide fire alarm went off advising everyone to leave the building until the alarm was investigated. Along with my other 3rd floor hotelmates we trudged down the emergency stairs only to get to the bottom floor and be told it was a kitchen fire and we could go back to our rooms. The alarm continued to blare for another 15 minutes or so. At around 11 PM I set the alarm on the alarm clock and went to bed. At 4 AM I was awakened by the sound of garbage trucks emptying the dumpsters that are directly below the windows of all the rooms on that side of the hotel. That's also the side with the interstate and noise from cars, etc. I went back to sleep until 5 AM when the alarm went off as set. The shower was fine but this is where you can really tell that the hotel was remodeled but not completely. The shower nob and sink nob were the old 1980's acrylic nobs. One nob to control hot and cold and you turn it to get to the temp you want. It was dated and you could defnitely tell it wasn't part of the remodel. You could also see built up grime on the double toilet paper holder built into the wall, another hold out, I assume, from the pre remodeled room. I use a hairdryer and flat iron and there was limited space on the sink counter for everything I use to get ready for the day. The mirror above the sink was a full wall mirror like you see in dated hotels. My flight was delayed and I stayed in the room until 7 AM. I caught the 7:05 AM shuttle to the airport. The driver was courteous enough but upon arrival at the airport, where it was misty and lightly snowing/raining, he dropped us off in the uncovered area. This hotel was over $150 with the corporate rate I get. I wouldn't stay there again. The ALOFT across the street was the same price and new. I think they did a great job with the remodel but they stopped short of a complete remodel and you can tell.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chroma9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights while we visited Philadelphia. We decided on this hotel because it was more affordable than the any downtown and rented a car from the airport to get back and forth. It was a 10-15 minute drive from the hotel to the historic district. We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The maids always said "Hello" or "Good Morning" with a smile on their face. When we first walked in we were impressed by the updated and clean lobby. We were checked in quickly by the friendly desk clerk and given our key cards. The hallways of the hotel do look dated but appear to be clean. Our room was very nice and updated with furniture, pictures and a flat screen TV, it wasn't prefect but no major complaints. The bed was nice but the pillows were way to soft for us. Parking is $6.00 a night but you can get out for free with your room key card if you are staying more than one night. So even for a week long stay you would only pay $6.00 the day you check out. The hotel is right next to the interstate but we never noticed the traffic even though our room faced that direction. Wireless internet is free. They do serve breakfast at a "restaurant" in the lobby. It's expensive but good. I think the prices are the same whether you order room service or eat in the lobby so you may want to keep that in mind. I've read some really bad reviews on this hotel but in our experience they were unfounded. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the negativity?”
Reviews.Author: Cru3rdBari
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why there are so many negative comments about this hotel on Hotwire and Travel Advisor. I had a wonderful experience, even though my room from Hotwire that was given to me was a handicapped accesible room with no towel hooks for large towels in the bathroom. There was also no counter in the bathroom, so I dragged the mobile desk in there to put my stuff on. Excellent location by the airport, and the shuttle runs every 30 minutes there. I was able to get the SEPTA to the city with no problems there. The restaurant closed on Sunday at 11 am, so I went to the Sheraton Suites across the street and bought a $30 9 oz. sirloin steak, but it was good. The staff were friendly and accomodating with no problems there. I know from other hotels in Philadelphia that customer service simply is not a priority for many of the people who work in the service industry there.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: sportstravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: The lobby and outside condition seemed fine. The hallway did seem a little depressing. The room itself was mostly fine. Although the walls needed cleaning in some places. The problem was the bathroom. There was mold on the tile, the tub needed a good scrub, the paint in the ceiling was peeling, and the wallpaper needed cleaning. The wall paper job itself just looked shoddy. The bed and linen were comfortable and in good condition. The staff were nice and polite. Parking is six dollars a day. It was a comfortable stay but I'm not sure if I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Redpatch7
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service, employees at desk seemed to be doing us a favor by checking us in. Drunks out in front of hotel who ogled my daughter were a nice touch. No food on premises, poor parking. This really did not give us a good impression of the city. When we return someday we will definitely stay somewhere else. I guess this is what you can expect from an airport hotel. YUCK.

Reviews.Title: “Anyone wanting to stay enywere else is nuts!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: philliesrbest
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on july 20-21 2009. We were under the understanding we could not check in till 3 pm. We asked if we could come early and use the pool? They said no problem, come to the desk and let us know your here.Well they had a room ready at 10:45 and checked us in! The room was very clean and nice!Exrta towels were no problem and arrived with in a minute of me calling! The stewart did not hang for a tip he walked away and I had to call him back to tip him! As we approached the elevator to go to the pool a maintanance man greated us in a very friendly manor and jumped in the elevator and pushed our floor for us! The pool is clean and towels abundant!All the staff is fantastic. They made me feel like a millionaire! Anything you need they are there! This family stays at Sheraton no matter where we are traveling from now on!!!! Thanks so much!!! Thanks! thanks! thanks! This place is a palace, and guests are kings!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! May God Bless you all!!!!!!!!!!!!! The greatest place to stay in Philadelphia!! They help you know what the city of brotherly love means! 10,0000 Gold stars! Next Phillies game we go to guess where we are staying!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not well kept”
Reviews.Author: IndyMom2
Reviews.Content: The lobby and reception were great - but one step off the elevator and the filthy carpet told the story. The room was average but the desk had crumbs on it and the floor was not only stained but dirty: something an occasional vacuuming could have taken care. The room-service "menu" - two stapled sheets of paper, was obviously well handled and didn't match what the folks in the restaurant had available. The in-room coffee mug was dirty and the coffee pot chipped. The bathroom was in need of a good moping and I wished I had flip flops for the shower - yuck. Room service and food was fine but another dirty glass. Drop off at the airport the following morning was quick and efficient. I filled out a comment card and gave it to the front desk. They were busy so I didn't expect immediate feed-back, but we're almost a month out without a word. My bill was hard to understand with an assortment of charges and credits and my Amex card was charged yet another amount. The accounting department was quick and responsive and resolved that issue within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay but not what I'm used too:”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Four Points Shearton Airport because of a missed flight. We arrived at the hotel around 10pm and the hotel was bustling with people who had the same problem as I with missed flights. So the lobby was very busy. The lobby area is nice since it has a big screen tv and a bar/restaurant area next to each other. The outdoor pool is located on the lobby floor as well (make sure to bring your room key) you need it for both getting out & in. The rooms are being renovated as we speak as the floor we were staying on had Wet Paint signs on it. The rooms are nice but the bathtub is the old porcelean tubs from the 1980's. I am used to the Hilton Experience, so having to pay for breakfast was something i wasn't used too. The shuttle service runs on the hour and half-hour and they have a little place next to the front desk to get sundrie items and such. They also have a computer in the lobby to use for free.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: Slc_UtMattswife
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a row. Beds not great. Room service was awful. Restaurant prices were not worth what you got. Probably good for one night stays, if you eat away from resort. Don't leave anything behind, you'll never see it again. Forgot to pack clothes in closet. Called for one full week, everyday, twice a day and never heard back from anyone and no one would help me other sending me to peoples voicemails. Came back to hotel in person and was told that housekeeping had not turned in any clothing left behind. Had to buy all new maternity clothing. Will not stay here again. Staff not very friendly or helpful. You also have to pay a daily rate to park, regardless of what the reservations people tell you.

Reviews.Title: “Buy New Beds, People!”
Reviews.Author: ferd62
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worse bed I've slept in: Caved in the middle, it was like sleeping on a hillside. Everything else about the room was great, it appeared to be newly-remodeled; but, in the end, a hotel is about a good night's sleep, and Sheraton didn't deliver that.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a night”
Reviews.Author: broooce
Reviews.Content: Won this on priceline for $49, only stayed one night, staff were ok, not overly happy with their lot or particularly pleased to see you approach the desk. Free wifi was good, parking $6 per day was a bit much when you are staying there the whole time and not using it to park while you jet off from the airport. We had breakfast at the hotel and had the pancakes which were excellent and very filling. We also ate at the nearby Ruby Tuesdays which was excellent. Room was clean and overall I was pleased with my priceline win.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep a wink”
Reviews.Author: guenevere51
Reviews.Content: Contrary to what other reviewers have said, I found our room reasonably clean and the service perfectly fine. Two serious problems kept me from sleeping, though. First, the thermostat didn't want to go below 68 degrees (which is warm for me, and it was an extremely warm night for April), so I woke up in the middle of the night roasting. When the air was on, it was extremely loud. Second, the rooms only have sheer curtains, and ours faced east. By 5:45 AM, it was practically broad daylight in our room. I have no idea why they wouldn't put some decent curtains in there. You couldn't pay me to go back to this place unless they fixed those issues.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations from lobby crushed in the hallway...”
Reviews.Author: tothegypsy
Reviews.Content: USAirways gave me a voucher for the Four Points at PHL after a flight delay. The hotel is located across from several other hotels - a brand new aloft by W, Sheraton Suites, and Hilton. Do be advised, however, that there are virtually no restaurants in the immediate area. I did take the shuttle to/from PHL and found it on time and reliable. Upon arrival, I noticed the lobby looked great. Very open and pleasant and appeared to be recently renovated. The bar/restaurant was nice, and my dinner was prepared well. The staff at the bar were all very nice. Once I got off the elevator to go to my room, I started getting suspicious. The hallways are dank and musty - totally opposite of what I would have expected from the bright lobby. The room was adequate - bathroom with separate vanity space, large flat-screen TV, king sized bed (somehow with only one pillow...), desk, and chair. The bathroom itself was a little small but fine for a solo traveler. For the most part, the room was clean. However, I was a little appalled at a dust buildup on the air vent. I thought the room was a little musty, but wasn't going to put much thought into it - until I went to change the thermostat, and the air filter cover protruding from the wall caught my eye - it was completely covered in dust at least an inch thick. That kind of buildup has been there for quite some time. Finally, Starwood has some bizarre thing that turns on the TV in unoccupied rooms to run the in-house channel...somehow, mine came on at 5 AM and blasted me out of bed so I could learn about pay-per-view movies.

Reviews.Title: “Long wait and questionable cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: away4now2
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this particular hotel in as many months My company's corporate travel office make the reservations to my displeasure. First off, despite the close proximity to the airport, the shuttle service pick-up is very slow. Had to wait 45 minutes one day, one hour another, and 50 minutes the third day. I know the shuttle is supposed to leave the hotel on the hour and on the half hour, seems it doesn't apply to pick guests up at the airport. Seems the shuttle drivers do whatever they choose, and often the front desk does not relay the pick-up request to the drivers. The front desk staff are impersonable, often on private personal phone calls, or visiting with other staff members, while the guest waits for acknowledgment. Now, for hotel and room amenities. Some rooms are decent, other's are something to be desired. On my most recent stay, Feb 2 through Feb 5, I had a used 1/2 bottle of lotion, which I promptly tossed in the garbage can, and one wash cloth, and two towels in my room, the previous day's newspaper under the door, and that day's newspaper in the hall in front of the door upon check-in. The next day.....no lotion, no shampoo replenishment. If you go to the bar, plan on spending $10 for a glass of house wine, and the food prices are astronomical as well. The computer printer in the lobby was out of paper, I went to the desk to report it, and the girl paused her personal phone call, and handed me a stack of paper for me to load into the printer. Nice service?!?! I hate staying at this hotel, and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The worse Four Points Visted”
Reviews.Author: Chefwayne
Reviews.Content: Dirty microwaves on the Guest Floor. Did Not change the towels when cleaning the room hotel smelled like can air freshener throughout parking was not convient no continiential breakfast and customer service sucked! Never will I visit this place again

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: PrinzII
Reviews.Content: The first thing about this hotel that strikes you is the lobby. However, it's a shame the rooms do not match in terms of design. The sleeping area is not much bigger than two office cubicles but a farily large bed is in there. The bed itself wasn't bad but there were no decent amenities in the room. On top of that, the hotel was much higher than the Doubletree I stayed at the week prior. For instance, pancakes costing $10 or more. There is a very weak wireless signal in your room which eminates from the common area. The bathrooms were, for lack of a better word, dated and boring. Granted, the distance to the airport was better than the Doubletree, but in hindsight, I should have made my reservation there for the following week versus this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Steph000
Reviews.Content: Booked through starwood with cash and points. The room was ok, seemed like it needed some upgrades. The staff was great to supply extra water upon request but, the computer downstairs didn't work and overall it seemed somewhat run down. It is convenient to the airport and has shuttles to and fro. If you need a place close the the airport and only plan to sleep there because you have an early flight, this may be the place for you, otherwise, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Value with Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: Goodguydoug
Reviews.Content: 4 Point Sheraton We choose the 4 Point Sheraton hotel in as they offer the option of the Park and fly your car while you are on vacation. The hotel overall was very nice, the lobby was bright and clean with large windows and comfortable chairs. A nice bar was behind that area if you choose to have a drink and behind that was their eating area, where we had breakfast the next day, which offered a nice variety of good food. Our hotel room was on the 5th floor and it was clean and comfortable with a king bed and three pillows. My objections on the pillows is that they were on the small size and somewhat flat. I would think if you have a king size bed you should have king size pillows to go along with it. Our room also included a nice flat screen TV and reclining chair. The TV had a wide selection of programs which was great, so you could easily find something that you would like to pass the time away. The bathroom was split, with the toilet and tub in a room with the sink and counter right outside the door area which was fine. The bathroom worked well but you could tell it was of an older style but it was clean and worked well which is what you want and it included the usual soaps/shampoos/conditioners for showering. The sink located on the outside worked well too, but had limited counter space in our room, so if you were going to stay here of any length of time you would have to leave your toiletries on the dresser. I had the opportunity to use the steam iron that evening and that worked very well too. Oh, before I forget the hotel offers a free shuttle service from the hotel to the airport and back again, a nice convenience. So in conclusion if we were going on vacation and flying out of the airport would I stay here again? I sure would. Itâ€™s convenient, quiet, clean and comfortable and best of all, itâ€™s worth it for one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCheryl
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, modern hotel. The decor in the room and the public areas was very stylish and everything seemed new and fresh. The staff was very helpful. When we asked if there was a place to buy some fruit nearby, one of the staff went into the kitchen and brought back some apples for us - no charge. We were not bothered by noise from the airport at all. We chose the hotel because it was very well-priced for a 3star and I feel we got a great deal. One minor thing was that the bathroom was a bit small. The room itself was good-sized, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel near Philly”
Reviews.Author: Lpaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during the 4th of July. We got an online offer staying 3 night 3rd night free so it was a amazingly good deal. I was very surprised when I first got to the hotel. I had much lower expectation of the hotel so when I saw a bright and spacious lobby and reception area I felt quite impressed. Their website said they had started the renovation many months ago and I thought by the time we got there it was probably all done. Some guest room doors were still being painted. However we weren't disturbed by the fume from inside our room. The hotel seems to identify themselves with more modern design. The toiletry was very nice. So here's the summary of my review: Pros: 15-min drive to downtown Philly, 10 to University district--nice decor--fairly clean overall--quiet even though it sits right off of the interstates--amazing deal for special rate. Cons: fume in hallway from paint-- $6/day parking--there's only 1 restaurant nearby(not walkable).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmbny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in June, 2008. The entire staff was very friendly and very helpful. The room was amazing! The bed was very comfortable. If we ever travel to Philly again, we would most certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pacwell
Reviews.Content: The Four Points meets all the expectations for an overnight stay. The rooms are basic but they are clean and roomy. There is a single restaurant at the hotel, which makes the hotel not so much viable for longer stays. There aren't any restaurants close by, and downtown Philadelphia is about a 20-25 minute drive. Therefore I'd think twice for extended stays. Considering the price, this hotel is a good value for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerless”
Reviews.Author: The_Truffles
Reviews.Content: If I had to describe a hotel as a colour, this hotel would be "beige". Everything was distinctly average. The fact that Delta had a load of staff staying here on a stop-over should tell you everything that you need to know about this place, i.e. that it is is cheap, no-frills and close to the airport. The bedroom was clean, the corridors and rest of the hotel not so. And don't bank on getting food here. The kitchen has the basic of meals and the one thing that did appeal to me, the soup, was served in a bowl that was covered in dried on food underneath the rim. I simply don't know why you would stay here by choice. This is somewhere you crash if you need to book somewhere in a hurry or your car has broken down right outside the entrance in the pouring rain at 2am. Thank goodness it was only one evening.

Reviews.Title: “New FAce”
Reviews.Author: NefertitiLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: When I got there I ws nervous as I usually book at the Sheraton Suties next door. However, wow this hotel also got a face lift. It became I would say one of the nicer hotels in the PHL airport area. Waht a great place to stay. So quaint and actually I like to call it a "hidden secret" in the area. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Weeks Stay”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for an assignment in Ridley Park. As the hotel was about 15 minutes away and close to the Airport, it was a good choice. The Hotel is in the same complex as the Sheraton Suites and shares the shuttle to/from the Airport. The staff is extremely pleasant and offer excellent service. I would rate them as the best feature of the hotel. The room was OK but in need of some refreshing besides the new beds which were excellent. The room was on the small size with two double beds. The rest of the furniture was somewhat worn but completely adequate for my purposes. Some minor rust on the sink and towel rack was evident but not really objectionable. I did note the the cover on the heating/cooling wall unit was loose but it performed well. I did not use the hotel bar or restaurant but they appeared nice and well appointed. There was a computer in the lobby with high speed internet access for the guests in addition to free high speed access in the room. Since I only used the room for sleeping and showering, it was acceptable. If I was in the room for more time during the day, it might have been less attractive. A final note, they were repaving the parking lot making for a short walk while I was there. I believe it is now complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Perfect for Airport service”
Reviews.Author: Brian03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight Oct. 19th. for an early flight the next morning. Prompt checkin. We were on the 5th floor. Non-smoking, 2 doulble beds. Very clean rooms, comfy beds. Are main concern was how the hotel airport shuttle would work. We had a 6 a.m. flight. The shuttle runs 24/7. We waited no more than 5 minutes for the huge shuttle. They loaded up our luggage and off we went for the 5 minute ride to the airport dropping us right off at our airline. When we returned on the 27th, we again waited no more than 5 minutes and back to the hotel we went. The best part is they offer a park and fly rate of 140.00 for 7 days. The area is gated and has security. We felt very comfortable leaving our car there for the week. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Ok- Staff was real nice & helpful”
Reviews.Author: jcssugar
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through the hotel website because my husband has severe allergies and has specific needs. A lot of good that did, those needs were never met. The room was not even vacuumed for us. There were potato chips on the floor. Hotel hall and rooms are in desperate need of maintenance repair, vacuum. I think all the airport hotels are like this though. On a better note the front desk staff was nice and seemed to be taking a lot of heat from people that said they had reservations and didn't. We got in late and wanted to eat, they had numerous take out menus to choose from that delivered until 1AM. I wanted to take a walk and asked if it was safe they assured me it was but would have the security jeep patrol me as well as the parking lot. The lot is well lit and patrolled 24 hours. The rooms are quite. FYI if you book through the hotel website they will send you a confirmation number and keep in touch with you numerous times before your stay. If you don't get anything call them. The airport/city hotels sell out and there is nowhere to stay these people were frantic, take heed.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: InQueens26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and decent. I did not hear any airplane noises. The bed was very comfortable. The pool looked clean and we even could see Philly in the distance from our window. The only bad thing was that it is not too close to the city. You are defiantely on the outskirts, but we had a car and it was no problem to get around , it is right by the highway. For the price it is good.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst hotel I've stayed in but . . .”
Reviews.Author: DiamonDave
Reviews.Content: It comes pretty close! We booked this hotel for a one night stay based largely on the Sheraton reputation. Granted this is a Four Points but it does not even deserve that distinction. It looks like it might have been a decent Sheraton 25 to 30 years ago and now has been demoted. Much of the furniture and the wall coverings seem to be from that era. The desk chair was so beat up I would be embarrassed to have it in my house. We actually saw two rooms in this hotel. The first one we got had an extremely loud A/C unit and a funky smell. We called down to the front desk and the manager was very happy to show us another room. We met him there and we caught him just coming out of the bathroom. Not very professional I would say. He did give us two comp. drinks at the bar downstairs that were the highlight of the stay. The second room still had the same kind of beat up furniture but was less noisy. The hotel is very convenient to the airport if that is an important factor for you. We actually got out of paying the $5 parking fee due to a misunderstanding at the parking attendant's booth. It is true that the staff has little knowledge of the tourist attractions in Philly. I realize that on the East Coast hotels are more expensive but $130 for this dilapidated inn is too much.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better but could be worse!”
Reviews.Author: lexieou
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel because it was close to the airport. The first night our room was clean and we were pleased. We went to Lancaster after that and returned the last couple of nights there for our stay. When we returned the second time, our room was clean but quite noisy from the a/c unit, so they moved us to another room. In this room, the bathroom walls were not clean at all and the carpet was also stained. The staff was very nice but didn't know how to give you directions to some of the sites in Philadelphia. The shuttle guys were super! They were very helpful and there to take you when you needed to go. There was plenty of parking and I felt safe at this hotel. I think it is a little pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: dlotz55
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel for a quick stay, especially near the airport. Interesting point: I never heard the flight traffic at all - very well insulated. They are trying a new idea: "Element" This is a continental breakfast presented as only Sheraton and Starwood Properties would do it. Fresh baked pastries, bistro type breakfast sandwiches, fruit smoothies, along with some of the other usual items. The presentation was very nice, and the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about this pilot program. They also took great pride in their efforts, and it showed. The rest of the hotel is not so much dated, but you can tell that it was a Days Inn at one time. It just has that feel. Overall, I would return if I were in a similar situation on business.

Reviews.Title: “A Noisy Night”
Reviews.Author: eBzky
Reviews.Content: This review is based on a one-night stay for a business trip. I arrived into Philadelphia late and needed to stay somewhere near the airport. Based on a limited stay, there were two problems with my room. First, the air unit was quite noisy, and it woke me up at least twice. The second issue was the phone near the bed, which was broken and unusable. The phone would ring, but otherwise did not work ... and that made for an interesting wake-up call. I was able to stay at this hotel with a company discount. I would not recommed this hotel at the regular rates. There are better options near the airport, including a Sheraton Suites just across the street. This hotel was sufficient for a one-night stay near the airport, but I would have liked a little more sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: poolprincess
Reviews.Content: I had trouble finding a hotel on line that would let us leave the car there and stay at the end of the trip. Thus, I turned to AAA. They gave me a variety of properties to chose from, the Four Points Sheraton being one in the mid-price range. There were no problems leaving the car. It is a secure lot, not with a fence, but with a gate and attendant and you must have a pass from the hotel to leave. Shuttle service on arrival and return was excellent. We arrive back at 1am. Check in was quick. Beds were fabulous, fluffy and room was spotless, though the bathroom was small. Breakfast was not included and was a little pricey. All in all it was a good, safe place to stay while returning from a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the airport and I-95... that's the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: eromitlabhitw
Reviews.Content: Paid $99 a night (with free parking) to stay at this dump, when the Sheraton across the way was only $10 a night more. My decision was based on being able to have free Internet access, but I had computer problems and couldn't make use of it, so I got to experience this hotel's finer points. Ha. Hotel's lobby is nice, but that's about all that's nice. Room is sparsely furnished and could use renovation. Beds are average at best. When I stayed, the hotel was full of loud guests and you can hear it all from well inside your room thanks to the thin walls. The hotel does a lot of park, sleep & fly packages, which could leave you out of luck as far as a parking space goes depending on when you get in. Don't forget to insist on having your parking ticket stamped if free parking is included... the desk clerk didn't think to do it and the lot attendant wanted to charge me upon leaving the lot the first time, then rudely informed me I *had* to get it stamped when I got back or else I would be charged in arrears. Not that it mattered... when I got back and for the rest of my stay, the gate into the lot was unattended.
