My second night, my door card inexplicably stopped working and, ironically, the desk clerk wondered if I was in the right hotel because I had a Sheraton door key, which was what I was handed by the desk clerk on arrival. Also, housekeeping didn't bother to make up the room or replenish the bottled water. Don't even bother for the free internet, just stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport!”
Reviews.Author: Travels-with-Billy
Reviews.Content: The Four Points gave us exactly what we were looking for. A clean and comforable room near the airport. Don't expect a Ritz Carlton experience, but there is nothing wrong at all with this property.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: lc2cassina
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump with the laziest most unhelpful staff. The room was dirty, smelled funky and the bathroom grout was full of mold. The staff is painfully slow and any question or request was met with an attitude of why are you bothering me. This place is terrible and at $150 ridiculously overpriced. Will never stay there again. Unfortunately I didn't check the Tripadvisor reviews before booking so I have no one to blame but myself.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the hotel to check in, the lady at the front desk looked soooo tired and sleepy and did not even say 'Hi' or 'Welcome'. The rooms looked dark and one of the lamps wasn't working. There was mold on the vent in the bathroom. I filled up the form that night to order room service breakfast but was awakened at 9:30am by the cook, asking what I wanted in my omelette. Called me for the second time if I wanted juice or coffee. All these information were already in that form! The guy who brought the breakfast knocked on my door and then handed me the tray (which I almost dropped). The next day, my mom and I decided to eat at the restaurant downstairs. I asked for coffee and got an empty pot with coffee streaks on it. The waitress didn't give us cups either! When I asked for the coffee, the waitress just filled the same streaky pot and poured the coffee right into my cup. I then asked for creamer and she reached out to the other table (where a couple had just left off) and gave me the creamer that was sitting there! I had to ask for a fresh cup of creamer this time AND a spoon to stir the coffee! I've never had such terrible service in ANY of the hotels I've stayed in before! Finally, watch your bill...they somehow added a $10.99 movie in there which I had to ask them to take off. The only thing good about this hotel is the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: cl1811
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points Philadelphia Airport this weekend. No problem finding a parking space. Many handicapped spaces offered. Parking only $5. Parking attendant helpful with local directions. Front desk staff friendly. Free internet and printer use in the lobby for those not travelling with a laptop. Clean, decent hotel. My room was large and well-kept. Free bottled water in the room. Very comfortable bed. Alarm clock and wake-up call both in working order. Airport shuttle was quick. Shuttle bus could hold at least 16 passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Alright but not great”
Reviews.Author: templegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the weekend after Valentines Day, we got a rate of $135 which included breakfast for 2, upon checking in the front desk clerk did not even let us know our rate included breakfast or even where we would get the breakfast from. Secondly, they give you complimentary water, when we got to the room there was no water and when they finally brought some it was only 1 bottle for two people. The room itself was nice, the bed was comfortable, the tv was a little dated, but there was cable and the bathroom was small but clean. The room also had a full length ironing board and iron. Upon checking out, the front desk clerk charged me extra for something and had to redo my checkout which took quite sometime. Overall, the hotel itself, including the food was pretty good, but the staff, especially the people at the front desk were unprofessional, not very helpful and not very friendly. For those traveling, it was very close to the airport and it seemed like the shuttle ran pretty frequently and parking was only $5 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in service”
Reviews.Author: ziblets_2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night prior to International flight for the convenience of parking while vacationing. The parking lots were quite full and we drove around a while before we found a spot. The room was OK, appeared to be in the middle of repairs - patching seen on the ceiling of the bathroom. Could use a serious new coat of paint and updating, but clean. The bed was fantastic! We did not receive our wake-up call. When we inquired about this at the front desk the person did not even know where the call book was. The hotel offers shuttle service to and from the airport - supposedly every 15 minutes - another reason we chose to stay here. However, the shuttles were too small (about 6 people) and slow and we had to wait over 40 minutes to be able to get a ride. Compounded with the fact we did not get a wake up call this could have been disastrous. Upon our return the shuttles were again slow and full, but we did get more of a bus style vehicle when one finally arrived. We counted the number of competitor hotels' and rental car company's shuttles that passed us and they appeared to be showing every 5 minutes with plenty of room on them. While waiting we called the hotel to tell them to send us a large shuttle but they did not seem to care much. If you are not worried about using the shuttle this is an OK place to stay. It's clean and the beds are very comfy. Just don't expect much in service and bring your own alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “If you like roaches this is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't go - horrible, horrible place â€“ the room was badly in need of repair, dirty and the room key also given to someone else after our check-in, who then proceeded to let themselves in, which jammed the door lock, trapping us inside the room. Goodness knows what would have happened if we had already left to have something to eat â€“ presumably all our bags would be gone? After this a maintenance engineer turned up and took over an hour to fix the jammed door problem â€“ reappearing 5 times. We then got into bed and awoke 2 hours later being walked on by cockroaches â€“ I personally jumped out of bed and still had three down my back, 1 walking on my arm and another in my hair. A nest must have been under the headboard as they were walking all over it. We killed at least 20 in the bed alone. No-one answered the phone at reception from 2.30 until 4.30 when I gave up ringing after numerous attempts to contact someone. We complained at reception as we were leaving at 5.30 in the morning (couldn't sleep after that). No-one was bothered at all. We had an important business appointment later that day and turned up like zombies through lack of sleep. Since returning home to the UK I have contacted Starwood and the hotel but to no avail - no money back, just an offer for a free night in another hotel here, of which the have only a handful - the nearest is 300 miles away so I'm refusing to accept. They say they have had the room fumigated and its checked on a daily basis for more bugs - but I'm guessing that the bugs don't just live in one room, so watch out if you plan to stay there! If you'd like pictures I have them!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Markonbusiness
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property before, and was disappointed. The service was lacking, but my last stay in September things seemed to turn around for the better. The desk staff was great, they have a lot of new people that are still in training, but they seemed to have gotten it right. They wanted to assist me in any way possible. The rooms were on the smaller size, but they can't change that without building a whole new property. I loved the bed, I already ordered one for my home, and the restaurant changed their menu. Only thing I wish they would do is put high speed internet in all of their rooms. I heard that only 1/2 of the rooms have it. Good job Four Points, keep up the change...

Reviews.Title: “stay away, far away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night because of the 24 hour shuttle service to the airport. I inquired about parking for a week and was told it was five dollars a day and to just leave my car where it was. The ticket apparently means nothing. I never registered my name to park or had the ticket validated. No one was in the gate booth entering or leaving, so how good is security for the parking lot? Nowhere in the hotel information does it mention a parking fee. On my return late at night I used the courtesy phone at the airport and got nothing but dial tone. I tried several other hotels and they answered, so the phone was working. I called 411 to get a number for the hotel, which put me on voicemail. There was an option on this number to dial 0 but the desk never answered. We finally got a number from the airport customer service people and contacted the shuttle. The shuttle drivers were fine. The front desk and the management are another story. The room was fair enough for the price, but barely. Restaurant and bar were small and cramped. Overall, stay away, far away.

Reviews.Title: “Keep an eye on your money”
Reviews.Author: laa23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on July 16, 2005. My initial opinion was like that of others, the front desk employees are absolutly miserable. Not only this, but we had to put the AC on 50 just to have the room get to a normal temperature. Then upon checking out, the front desk employee (the same miserable one that checked us in) asked me if my stay had previously been paid in full (I booked through Expedia) and I replied "Yes" and only had to pay the $5 per night parking charge (what a joke). Now today 7/18 I was on my banks' website and I see that they charged me not once, not twice but 3 seperate times over the past 2 days equaling $97.54!! And now of course no one will return my calls and Expedia keeps you on hold for an hour. But hey! The bed was so comfy!

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton Philadelphia Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 4101A Island Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19153
